intro: Rubus scaber var. fallax, commonly known as the rough raspberry or fallax raspberry, is a variant of the common bramble. It is characterized by its thorny stems and trifoliate leaves, which are typically covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are usually red when ripe, though they may vary in color depending on the variety. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodlands or along the edges of forests. This plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
